alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 10:24AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RIVER LEVELS ON THE RISE... The atmospheric river moving through the area this morning has caused rivers to rise from 0.5 to 2 inches of rainfall. Heavy rain will move back into the area through the late morning and persist through the afternoon. Additional rain amounts will be from 1 to 2 inches. This will produce more rapid rise on streams and river but at this time it is expected for them to remain within their banks. Some daily rainfall records will be broken. The heavy precipitation will move out of the area Wednesday late afternoon as the system slides to the southeast. For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 9:00am the stage was 124.41 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 126.66 feet is expected around 4:00am Thursday. ... For Indian River at Sitka: At 9:45am the stage was 21.56 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 24.57 feet is expected around 1:00pm Wednesday. ... For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 9:00am the stage was 12.25 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.26 feet is expected around 4:00pm Wednesday. ... For Mendenhall Lake : At 9:15am the stage was 6.24 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 8.38 feet is expected around 10:00pm Wednesday. Impacts: At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail.
